citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The written program of veterinary care could not be located at time of the inspection. Access to the written program is
important to ensure that adequate veterinary care as outlined in the written program is being followed. Each dealer and
exhibitor shall employee an attending veterinarian under formal arrangements. In case of a part time veterinarian or
consultant arrangements, the formal arrangements shall include a written program of veterinary care and regularly
scheduled visits to the premise of the dealer or exhibitor.
CORRECT BY 5/27/2023

A contingency plan has not yet been developed at this facility . Developing a plan that outlines actions to take in
emergency situations is necessary to protect animal health and well being . Dealers, exhibitors, intermediate handlers,
and carriers must develop, document, and follow an appropriate plan to provide for the humane handling, treatment,
transportation, housing, and care of their animals in the event of an emergency or disaster (one which could reasonably
be anticipated and expected to be detrimental to the good health and well-being of the animals in their possession).
CORRECT BY : 5/27/23
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
